posts.post_content:
@ blindcansee  
Flanking does stack, if 2 of these are in play, both instances of flanking go off and the blocking creature gets -2/-2.  
  
Its a nice 1-drop. This and [Spined Sliver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spined Sliver) are helpful is you end up against a sliver deck.

Posted By: SleetFox (4/29/2010 9:22:42 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Another sliver this combos really well with is [Hunter Sliver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hunter Sliver). By giving them provoke, you can choose what creature is going to block your sliver and get -X/-X. Having trouble taking out an indestructible fatty like [Darksteel Colossus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darksteel Colossus)? Put an [Entangler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Entangler) on him and force it to block several slivers. And [Suppression Field](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Suppression Field) can lend a hand for pesky creatures that always want to tap when you untap them. If only I had an angle for using it to take out elves...  
  
I would be remiss to not mention [Cavalry Master](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cavalry Master) if you're going for a cool flanking angle...
posts.html:
Another sliver this combos really well with is Hunter Sliver. By giving them provoke, you can choose what creature is going to block your sliver and get -X/-X. Having trouble taking out an indestructible fatty like Darksteel Colossus? Put an Entangler on him and force it to block several slivers. And Suppression Field can lend a hand for pesky creatures that always want to tap when you untap them. If only I had an angle for using it to take out elves...

I would be remiss to not mention Cavalry Master if you're going for a cool flanking angle...
